title: Tripadvisor to cut 20% of staff amid internal restructuring
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Tripadvisor plans to lay off 20% of staff, affecting employees globally, as part of an internal restructuring effort.
The restructuring will merge Tripadvisor and Viator divisions and focus more on experience-driven growth and AI integration.
The company aims for $85 million in cost savings and plans to integrate its platforms with ChatGPT in coming weeks.

title: An abandoned tent has spurred a hiking mystery in New Hampshire
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: An abandoned tent found in New Hampshire's White Mountains has puzzled local hikers and search officials.
A set of car keys and an Apple AirTag found in the tent have not helped identify the owner.
No missing hiker reports have been filed, and officials hope social media posts will help solve the mystery.

title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, a former Patriots cheerleader, founded CharityTeams in 2008, raising $42 million for nonprofits through athletic events.
Hurley, known for her work with Boston Marathon runners, organized events like the 'Superhero 17' training run.
She passed away at 62 from ovarian cancer, survived by her fiancé Barry Foland, two sons, and extended family.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket partnered with Zero Gravity Beer to launch 'More For Your Dollar' lager.
The new lager is available at MB Spirits and MB Beer & Wine in Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire.
The beer launch follows the recent ousting of Market Basket CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court is reviewing the involvement in a public defender work stoppage affecting over 900 defendants.
Legislative pay raises for bar advocates have been insufficient, with advocates seeking further increases over separation of powers concerns.
The SJC heard arguments from defense attorney groups and state officials, expressing hesitance about intervening in legislative pay matters.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston, signing her novel co-authored with Harlan Coben.
Witherspoon attended Harvard Business School for a discussion, reflecting on her role in 'Legally Blonde'.
She promotes Reese's Book Club, spotlighting women-centered books by female authors each month.

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Republican lawmakers question Gov. Healey's hiring process after LaMar Cook's cocaine trafficking arrest.
GOP leaders demand Healey disclose details on Cook's 2023 hiring and background check procedures.
Calls for independent investigation emerge amid Republican criticisms in the 2026 gubernatorial race.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, were killed in a crash on Route 140 South, New Bedford.
The crash occurred around 2 a.m.; Siqueira was pronounced dead at the scene, and De Carvalho died in the hospital.
The 18-year-old driver survived with non-life-threatening injuries; the crash investigation by Massachusetts State Police is ongoing.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police seek help identifying a suspect in commercial burglaries using a pry tool since August 21.
Similar break-ins reported by Boston University, Cambridge, and Northeastern University police through September 25.
Stolen items include credit cards, cash, and electronics; Boston police released suspect photos for public assistance.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tennessee Titans reportedly refused to trade with New England Patriots due to owner Amy Adams Strunk's negative feelings about Mike Vrabel.
Vrabel, a former Titans coach, was fired after a 6-11 season and hired by the Patriots, where he's seen success.
Titans, currently 1-8 under new coach, did not make trades at the deadline, continuing their post-Vrabel struggles.
